function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate housing design for pandemic conditions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Loss of community and engagement within the building","category":"Social and cultural risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited adaptability of apartment layouts to changing user needs","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adequate indoor and outdoor spaces for collective living areas","category":"Social and cultural risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited application of guidelines may lead to inadequate disease mitigation measures in residential buildings.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited access to common areas in dense urban areas may hinder the implementation of disease mitigation measures.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lower application rate of the resilient residential model may result in suboptimal disease resilience during the pandemic and beyond.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex relationship between users and their residential space","category":"Social and cultural risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of education and understanding among stakeholders in the design process","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate adaptation of existing housing stock to the new resilient residential space concept","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility in residential space design","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate residential space for full-time habitation","category":"Social and cultural risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependency on market value over use value of residential space","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to nature and outdoor spaces in residential buildings","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High density in residential buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate social distancing in indoor common areas","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate residential space for pandemic scenarios","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Abandonment of earlier housing concepts","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"General impoverishment of architectural work","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shortcomings of existing housing stock becoming more noticeable","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overproduction of residential buildings due to market policy","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in goods solely viewed through market value","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Resilient residential model for pandemic adaptation","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of specific measures for contagious disease propagation in residential buildings","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex issue requiring a thorough and integral approach","category":"Social and cultural risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Affirmative attitude towards residential space leading to complacency","category":"Social and cultural risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased exposure to pathogens in densely populated environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid dissemination of new diseases and elevated risk of pandemics","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid mutation of microorganisms and adaptation as a cause of human diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Indoor work places not designed to prevent the spread of airborne pathogens","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Air distribution systems may enhance transmission of airborne pathogens","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Methods applied should be non-life threatening, user friendly, and energy efficient","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pathogen dispersal through respiratory droplets during talking, coughing, and sneezing","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of respiratory droplets with deep lung pathogens during coughing","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of influenza a virus and other respiratory diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Respiratory aerosols containing pathogen-carrying particles emitted during coughing","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Coughed droplets with a size distribution of 0.62-15.9 mm were studied, indicating potential risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"More particles were retained in the sample bag during the cough droplet study, indicating potential for increased exposure to infectious particles.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"No significance was found in the effect of age and gender on droplet generation, potentially leading to underestimation of transmission risk in different demographic groups.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Evaporation and dispersion of respiratory droplets","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of infectious bioaerosols from vomit and feces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability in pathogen infectivity due to virulence, pathogen generation, and infective dose","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Survival of pathogens in the air based on environmental factors like air temperature and relative humidity","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of relative humidity on pathogenic bacteria and viruses","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of influenza a virus dependent on relative humidity","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Effect of humidity on virus survival","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Positive and negative influence of temperature on virus survival","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influenza virus transmission is more effective at lower temperatures, such as 5c, compared to higher temperatures like 20c or 30c.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Enveloped viruses may have different survival patterns at different temperatures compared to non-enveloped viruses.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Public health interventions may not be sufficient to stop disease outbreaks in modern society, according to mathematical models.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
